title: Is Vi inherently unbalanced?
body:
In my experience, playing as Vi can be extremely fun, her kit feels impactful and requires at least a modicum of skill to use effectively.

However, I generally believe that having more active abilities in a kit and more counterplay for opponents is important to good champion design.

This leads me to wonder if champions can have 3-hit passives and be well-designed and feel impactful.

It also leads me to wonder if her ultimate should be changed because of its range and unavoidability.

So I ask these questions of you:

1. Is it poor design to have the 3-hit passive of Denting Blows effect taking up an entire ability slot? Why or why not?

2. Is her ultimate unfair and too badly lacking in counterplay? if so, should it be changed? And lastly, if it were changed, what possibly could replace it to still deliver on her theme and gameplay fantasy?

I'd like to reiterate that I like Vi as she is, and I'm not necessarily in favor of changing her. Simply expressing my confusion and doubts as I discover that my ideals clash with her kit design. What are your thoughts on the matter?

How do you feel about the keystone that reduces ultimate cooldowns? Will it completely break Vi?

Nah, the opportunity costs for grabbing that rune are significant, given that the inspiration tree gives no direct offensive/defensive boosts. Not only that, but Vi's ult has such a substantial CD that it would take **AGES** to actually proc the rune and lower that CD substantially enough to matter.

As great as that lowered cooldown would be, I suspect Vi's probably going to want something that more directly impacts her jungling and/or how effectively she can dive, as opposed to how *often* she can do so.
Thank you for contributing!

I apologize, I was unclear. I'm not opposed to 3-hit passives. I'm just generally opposed to them taking up an ability slot instead of being part of a champion's inherrent passive.

I play mages and assassins usually because I enjoy having a variety of different abilities to cast and more choices as to which ability to use in a given circumstance. Champions like Vayne waste an entire ability slot on this, leaving them with less options and actions that they can take besides auto-attacking.

Examples of good ways to use 3-hit passives: Old Xin Zhao made up for it by having the active of the ability grant attack speed. Tahm Kench is another example, the 3-hit passive interacts with the rest of his kit, but he still has 3 basic abilities to choose between when deciding what to do.

And now that I think about it Vi partially makes up for this by her E being on an ammo system. But now I wonder if it should maybe be switched with her passive to give her an active ability that offers her a shield. Thematically speaking there is a lot of cool potential there.
